content.raw:
I don't want to derail this, but it just seems weird to me that the content of the `<uri>` tag would not be a URI, since a scheme is required

and [wikipedia says](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_URI_scheme#How_many_slashes?) `file://relative/path` is not valid according to [RFC8089](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8089) but lots of people do it anyway

so we could follow the crowd and misuse `file:`, use a different scheme like `path:` or just use a non-URI string with no scheme
